assets.name: BottleWashingAndCappingMachine

semantic.description: A specialized laboratory machine designed to automate the washing and capping of bottles, commonly used to prepare glassware for sterilization or media storage.

assets.notes: Large cleaning equipment typically placed on the floor or a dedicated washing station area.

assets.name: VolumetricFlask

semantic.description: A piece of laboratory glassware calibrated to contain a precise volume at a certain temperature, characterized by a pear-shaped body and a long neck with a single graduation mark, used for precise dilutions and preparation of standard solutions.

assets.notes: Precision glassware used for preparing standard solutions. Unlike other glassware, it should not be heated to avoid altering its calibrated volume.

assets.name: VolumetricFlask

semantic.description: A pear-shaped laboratory glass flask with a flat bottom and a long neck containing a single graduation mark, used for preparing solutions to a precise volume.

assets.notes: Precision glassware used for preparing standard solutions; handle with care to maintain calibration.

assets.name: VolumetricFlask

semantic.description: A pear-shaped glass flask with a flat bottom and a long neck containing a single graduation mark, used for preparing precise volumes of solutions.

assets.notes: Precision glassware used for preparing standard solutions. Should not be heated to maintain calibration accuracy.

assets.name: Beaker

semantic.description: A cylindrical glass container with a flat bottom and a small spout for pouring, widely used for mixing, stirring, and heating liquids in the laboratory.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory glassware used for mixing and heating liquids.

assets.name: BiologicalSafetyCabinet

semantic.description: An enclosed, ventilated laboratory workspace for safely working with materials contaminated with pathogens requiring a defined biosafety level.

assets.notes: Large safety equipment used for containment of biological hazards; typically placed on the floor.

assets.name: TestTube

semantic.description: A common piece of laboratory glassware consisting of a finger-like length of glass or clear plastic tubing, open at the top and closed at the bottom, used to hold, mix, or heat small quantities of chemicals.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for holding, mixing, or heating small amounts of chemicals.

assets.name: TestTube

semantic.description: A common piece of laboratory glassware consisting of a finger-like length of glass or clear plastic tubing, open at the top and closed at the bottom, used to hold, mix, or heat small quantities of chemicals.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory glassware used for holding, mixing, or heating small quantities of substances.

assets.name: Burette

semantic.description: A graduated glass tube with a stopcock at the bottom, used for dispensing variable, measured amounts of a chemical solution, commonly in titrations.

assets.notes: Precision glassware used for titrations; handle with care to avoid breakage.

assets.name: ReagentCabinet

semantic.description: A specialized storage unit designed for organizing and safely storing chemical reagents and laboratory supplies.

assets.notes: Large storage furniture typically placed on the floor to house chemical reagents.

assets.name: Centrifuge

semantic.description: A motor-driven device that spins liquid samples at high speed to separate components of different densities.

assets.notes: Motor-driven instrument used for separation; requires careful balancing of samples to ensure safe operation.

assets.name: Chair

semantic.description: A movable seat with a backrest, often adjustable and designed for ergonomic support during laboratory work.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory furniture placed on the floor for personnel use.

assets.name: Crucible

semantic.description: A cup-shaped container capable of withstanding extremely high temperatures, used for heating, melting, or calcining substances.

assets.notes: Ceramic container designed for high-temperature heating; handle with tongs when hot.

assets.name: CryogenicCabinet

semantic.description: A specialized storage cabinet designed to maintain extremely low temperatures, typically below -80°C, for the long-term preservation of biological samples and heat-sensitive reagents.

assets.notes: Large cold storage equipment typically placed on the floor due to its size and weight.

assets.name: DistillationFlask

semantic.description: A round-bottom glass flask with a long neck and a side arm, specifically designed for distillation processes.

assets.notes: Standard glassware designed for distillation processes; fragile and heat-resistant.

assets.name: DryingOven

semantic.description: A thermally insulated chamber used for heating, drying, or sterilizing laboratory glassware and samples.

assets.notes: Generates significant heat; used for drying and sterilizing. Ensure proper ventilation and keep away from flammable solvents.

assets.name: ElectricSoilPenetrometer

semantic.description: An electrically operated instrument used to measure soil compaction and penetration resistance, essential for assessing soil physical properties in agriculture and civil engineering.

assets.notes: Electrically operated instrument for measuring soil physical properties; ensure electrical safety.

assets.name: ElectronicScale

semantic.description: A precise measuring instrument used to determine the mass of an object, typically displaying the weight digitally.

assets.notes: Precision instrument for mass measurement; requires a stable surface on the experimental platform.

assets.name: ErlenmeyerFlask

semantic.description: A type of laboratory flask featuring a flat bottom, a conical body, and a cylindrical neck, commonly used for mixing, heating, and titration.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory glassware used for mixing, heating, and titration.

assets.name: FlatBottomFlask

semantic.description: A glass flask with a round body and a flat base, allowing it to stand upright on a level surface; used for holding, mixing, and heating liquids.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for holding, mixing, and heating liquids. Handle with care to avoid breakage.

assets.name: Refrigerator

semantic.description: A thermally insulated appliance used to store reagents, samples, and biological materials at low temperatures to ensure preservation.

assets.notes: Large storage equipment typically placed on the floor. Used for preserving temperature-sensitive materials.

assets.name: FumeHood

semantic.description: A local ventilation device designed to limit exposure to hazardous or toxic fumes, vapors, or dusts by venting them away from the user.

assets.notes: Large safety infrastructure used for ventilation; typically installed directly on the laboratory floor.

assets.name: GasChromatographyMassSpectrometer

semantic.description: An analytical instrument that combines gas chromatography and mass spectrometry to separate, identify, and quantify complex mixtures of chemicals.

assets.notes: High-precision analytical instrument containing heating elements (GC oven) and high-voltage components. Used for qualitative and quantitative analysis.

assets.name: GlassFunnel

semantic.description: A pipe with a wide, often conical mouth and a narrow stem, used to channel liquid or fine-grained substances into containers with a small opening.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for transferring liquids or fine-grained substances; fragile.

assets.name: GlassRod

semantic.description: A piece of laboratory equipment consisting of a solid glass stick, used to mix chemicals and liquids.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for stirring and mixing liquids. Fragile.

assets.name: GloveBox

semantic.description: A sealed container equipped with gloves that allows the manipulation of objects in a controlled, inert, or sterile atmosphere.

assets.notes: Large containment equipment used for handling air-sensitive or sterile materials; typically installed as a standalone unit on the floor.

assets.name: GrahamCondenser

semantic.description: A laboratory glass condenser featuring a coiled inner tube surrounded by a water jacket, designed to provide a large cooling surface area for efficient condensation, typically used in vertical setups.

assets.notes: Glassware instrument used for condensation in vertical setups; fragile and requires careful handling.

assets.name: GravityChromatographyColumn

semantic.description: A vertical glass tube, typically equipped with a stopcock, used to separate chemical compounds from a mixture by allowing solvent to flow through a stationary phase under gravity.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for separation and purification of chemical compounds.

assets.name: HeadspaceSampler

semantic.description: An instrument used in gas chromatography to extract volatile compounds from the gas phase above a liquid or solid sample for analysis.

assets.notes: Analytical instrument used in conjunction with gas chromatography; generates heat during sample incubation to extract volatiles.

assets.name: HeatingDevice

semantic.description: An electrical instrument used to heat samples, solutions, or glassware to controlled temperatures for chemical reactions or sample preparation.

assets.notes: Primary heat source for reactions; must be kept away from flammable materials and handled with care to prevent burns.

assets.name: HeatingPlate

semantic.description: A portable tabletop device with a flat surface containing an electric heating element, used for heating glassware and their contents in a laboratory.

assets.notes: Electric heating device; surfaces get hot. Must be kept away from flammable materials and solvents.

assets.name: InductivelyCoupledPlasmaMassSpectrometer

synonyms: 电感耦合等离子体质谱仪
semantic.description: A highly sensitive analytical instrument that uses an inductively coupled plasma to ionize samples for mass spectrometry, primarily used for detecting metals and non-metals at trace concentrations.

assets.notes: High-precision analytical instrument utilizing high-temperature plasma; requires exhaust ventilation and stable power supply.

assets.name: Incubator

semantic.description: A device used to grow and maintain microbiological cultures or cell cultures by maintaining optimal temperature, humidity, and other conditions.

assets.notes: Large equipment for maintaining biological cultures; generates controlled heat to maintain optimal temperature.

assets.name: InfraredSpectrophotometer

semantic.description: An analytical instrument used to identify and study chemical substances based on their absorption of infrared radiation.

assets.notes: Precision analytical instrument used for substance identification; typically placed on a validation or analytical bench.

assets.name: KippsApparatus

semantic.description: A laboratory apparatus used for the preparation of small volumes of gases by reacting a solid with a liquid without heating.

assets.notes: Glass apparatus used for controlled gas generation. While the apparatus itself is safe, it is often used to generate gases that may be toxic or flammable, requiring operation in a fume hood.

assets.name: KippsApparatus

semantic.description: A laboratory apparatus made of glass, designed for producing gases by the controlled reaction of a solid with a liquid without heating.

assets.notes: Glass apparatus used for gas generation; ensure proper ventilation if generating toxic gases.

assets.name: LiquidChromatograph

semantic.description: An analytical instrument used to separate, identify, and quantify components in a mixture using a liquid mobile phase.

assets.notes: Precision analytical instrument used for component separation and quantification. Requires proper management of liquid mobile phases and waste.

assets.name: GraduatedCylinder

semantic.description: A narrow, cylindrical glass container marked with horizontal lines to represent units of measurement, used to precisely measure the volume of liquids.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for measuring liquid volumes.

assets.name: MetallographicAnalyzer

semantic.description: An instrument designed for the study of the microstructure of metals and alloys, typically utilizing reflected light microscopy and image analysis systems.

assets.notes: Precision optical instrument for microstructural analysis; typically used for quality control and verification.

assets.name: MeteorologicalChromatograph

semantic.description: An analytical instrument used to separate, identify, and quantify components in gas mixtures, specifically designed for meteorological or atmospheric monitoring applications.

assets.notes: Analytical instrument for gas analysis. Requires stable bench space and appropriate gas connections.

assets.name: Microscope

semantic.description: An optical instrument used to observe objects that are too small to be seen by the naked eye, typically using a system of lenses to produce a magnified image.

assets.notes: Optical instrument used for observation and analysis; typically placed on a dedicated validation or analysis platform to protect precision optics.

assets.name: MuffleFurnace

semantic.description: A high-temperature heating device with an insulated chamber, commonly used for ashing samples, calcination, and heat treatment of materials.

assets.notes: High-temperature heating device; poses significant burn and fire hazards. Ensure proper ventilation if heating materials that release fumes.

assets.name: NucleicAcidExtractor

semantic.description: An automated laboratory instrument designed to isolate and purify nucleic acids (DNA or RNA) from biological samples for downstream applications.

assets.notes: Automated benchtop instrument for sample preparation; typically includes internal heating blocks for lysis and elution steps.

assets.name: Oscillator

semantic.description: A laboratory instrument used for mixing, blending, or agitating substances in containers through oscillating or shaking motion.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory instrument for mixing; ensure placed on a stable surface.

assets.name: Osmometer

semantic.description: A laboratory instrument used to measure the osmolality of a solution, typically by determining the freezing point depression or vapor pressure.

assets.notes: Analytical instrument for measuring osmolality; typically requires a stable benchtop environment for precision measurements.

assets.name: OxygenConcentrator

semantic.description: A device that concentrates oxygen from a gas supply (typically ambient air) by selectively removing nitrogen to supply an oxygen-enriched product gas stream.

assets.notes: Generates oxygen-enriched gas which significantly accelerates combustion. Keep away from open flames, sparks, and flammable materials. Typically placed on the floor due to size and vibration.

assets.name: OxygenGenerator

semantic.description: A device designed to generate or concentrate oxygen gas from ambient air or chemical sources for laboratory applications.

assets.notes: Generates oxygen gas which vigorously supports combustion. Keep away from flammable materials, oil/grease, and ignition sources.

assets.name: Pipette

semantic.description: A laboratory tool commonly used in chemistry, biology, and medicine to transport a measured volume of liquid.

assets.notes: Standard liquid handling instrument used for precise volume transfer.

assets.name: RotaryEvaporator

semantic.description: A device used in chemical laboratories for the efficient and gentle removal of solvents from samples by evaporation under reduced pressure.

assets.notes: Instrument containing glassware and a heating bath; used for solvent evaporation. Ensure proper vacuum setup and handle glassware with care.

assets.name: RoundBottomFlask

semantic.description: A spherical glass flask with a round bottom, designed for uniform heating and boiling of liquids, often used in distillation and chemical reactions.

assets.notes: Standard glassware designed for uniform heating and boiling; requires support (clamp/stand) due to round bottom.

assets.name: SeparatoryFunnel

semantic.description: A piece of laboratory glassware used in liquid-liquid extractions to separate the components of a mixture into two immiscible solvent phases of different densities.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for liquid-liquid extractions to separate immiscible liquids.

assets.name: Sterilizer

semantic.description: A device used to destroy microorganisms on laboratory equipment and supplies, typically using high-pressure saturated steam or dry heat.

assets.notes: Generates high heat and often pressure; used for sterilization of equipment.

assets.name: SuctionFlask

semantic.description: A thick-walled glass flask with a side arm tube, designed to withstand pressure changes during vacuum filtration processes.

assets.notes: Thick-walled glassware designed for vacuum filtration; capable of withstanding pressure differentials.

assets.name: TestTube

semantic.description: A common piece of laboratory glassware consisting of a finger-like length of glass or plastic tubing, open at the top and closed at the bottom, used to hold, mix, or heat small quantities of chemicals.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory glassware used for holding, mixing, or heating small quantities of chemicals.

assets.name: TestTube

semantic.description: A cylindrical glass or plastic tube with a rounded U-shaped bottom, widely used to hold, mix, or heat small quantities of liquid or solid chemicals.

assets.notes: Standard glassware used for holding, mixing, or heating small quantities of chemicals.

assets.name: Thermometer

semantic.description: An instrument used for measuring and indicating temperature, typically consisting of a graduated glass tube containing a liquid or a digital sensor.

assets.notes: Fragile glass instrument used for temperature monitoring. Handle with care to prevent breakage.

assets.name: ThermostaticWaterBath

semantic.description: A laboratory device consisting of a container filled with heated water, used to incubate samples at a constant temperature over a prolonged period.

assets.notes: A heat source used for maintaining constant temperature; typically placed on the experimental platform.

assets.name: ErlenmeyerFlask

semantic.description: A conical glass flask with a flat bottom and cylindrical neck, designed to allow swirling without spilling, widely used for titrations.

assets.notes: Standard glassware designed for swirling liquids without spilling; widely used for titrations and general mixing.

assets.name: TubeRack

semantic.description: A piece of laboratory equipment designed to hold multiple test tubes upright at the same time for storage, transport, or during experiments.

assets.notes: Standard support equipment for holding test tubes during experiments.

assets.name: TubeRack

semantic.description: A piece of laboratory equipment used to hold, store, or transport multiple test tubes or centrifuge tubes in an upright position.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory support equipment used for organizing and holding tubes during experiments.

assets.name: VacuumSterilizer

semantic.description: A sterilization device equipped with a vacuum system to remove air from the chamber, ensuring effective steam penetration and sterilization of porous loads or hollow instruments.

assets.notes: Generates high heat and pressure during operation; ensure proper safety protocols are followed.

assets.name: VolumetricFlask

semantic.description: A pear-shaped glass container with a flat bottom and a long neck containing a single graduation mark, used for preparing solutions of precise volumes.

assets.notes: Precision glassware used for preparing standard solutions; generally should not be heated to maintain calibration accuracy.

assets.name: VortexMixer

semantic.description: A laboratory device used to mix small vials of liquid by oscillating a rubber cup rapidly in a circular motion.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory mixing device used on experimental platforms.

assets.name: WashBottle

semantic.description: A squeeze bottle with a nozzle used to rinse various pieces of laboratory glassware, such as test tubes and round bottom flasks.

assets.notes: Standard plasticware used for dispensing distilled water or cleaning solvents.

assets.name: Computer

semantic.description: A programmable electronic device used for data processing, instrument control, and simulation in a laboratory setting.

assets.notes: Electronic equipment used for data processing and instrument control; should be kept away from liquids and corrosive fumes.

assets.name: experimentalplatform

semantic.description: A sturdy work surface or table designed for conducting scientific experiments, often providing space for instruments and reagents.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory furniture providing a workspace for experiments; typically made of chemical-resistant materials.

assets.name: ValidationPlatform

semantic.description: A specialized workstation or designated area equipped with necessary tools and instruments for performing validation tests and verifying experimental results.

assets.notes: A designated workstation for validation tasks; as a large piece of furniture/infrastructure, it is placed on the floor.

assets.name: PHMeter

semantic.description: An electronic device used to measure the hydrogen-ion activity (acidity or alkalinity) in water-based solutions.

assets.notes: Analytical instrument for measuring pH levels; contains fragile glass electrode.

assets.name: LaboratoryRoom

semantic.description: A defined enclosed space equipped with necessary facilities, utilities, and safety measures for conducting scientific experiments and research.

assets.notes: The primary infrastructure defining the laboratory space; contains all other assets.

assets.name: LaboratoryRoom

semantic.description: A designated physical space equipped for conducting scientific experiments, research, and teaching.

assets.notes: Infrastructure asset representing the physical laboratory space.

assets.name: Shelf

semantic.description: A flat horizontal plane or structure used for storing laboratory equipment, reagents, and other items.

assets.notes: Standard laboratory furniture used for storage; typically placed on the floor or mounted to walls.

assets.name: Water

semantic.description: A transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid compound of hydrogen and oxygen, serving as the most common universal solvent and cleaning agent in laboratory settings.

assets.notes: Universal solvent and cleaning agent; non-hazardous. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: AceticAcid

semantic.description: A colorless liquid organic compound with a pungent smell, classified as a weak acid and commonly used as a solvent or chemical reactant.

assets.notes: Flammable and corrosive organic acid with a pungent odor. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Acetone

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile, flammable liquid organic compound, widely used as an organic solvent.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and volatile organic solvent; must be kept away from ignition sources. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Acetonitrile

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile liquid that is the simplest organic nitrile, widely used as a polar aprotic solvent in organic synthesis and HPLC.

assets.notes: Flammable and toxic organic solvent (metabolizes to cyanide); requires proper ventilation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Benzene

semantic.description: A colorless, highly flammable liquid with a sweet odor, widely used as an organic solvent and chemical precursor.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and carcinogenic organic solvent; requires careful handling in a fume hood. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Chloroform

semantic.description: A colorless, dense, sweet-smelling liquid organic compound used primarily as a solvent and reagent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Chloroform is a toxic and volatile organic solvent. While generally non-flammable, it poses health risks and should be handled with care. All reagents are stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Cyclohexane

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable liquid cycloalkane with a distinctive detergent-like odor, commonly used as a non-polar solvent in chemical synthesis.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and volatile organic solvent; vapors may form explosive mixtures with air. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Dichloromethane

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile liquid organochloride with a moderately sweet aroma, widely used as a solvent in organic synthesis and as a paint stripper.

assets.notes: Volatile and toxic organic solvent (suspected carcinogen); generally considered non-flammable but vapors can be hazardous. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: DiethylEther

semantic.description: A colorless, highly volatile, and flammable liquid with a characteristic odor, commonly used as a non-polar solvent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Extremely flammable and volatile organic solvent. Can form explosive peroxides upon prolonged exposure to air and light. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: DimethylSulfoxide

semantic.description: A colorless liquid organosulfur compound and polar aprotic solvent that dissolves both polar and nonpolar compounds, widely used in chemical synthesis and biological applications.

assets.notes: Combustible liquid and polar aprotic solvent; known for its ability to penetrate skin and carry other dissolved chemicals into the body. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Dimethylformamide

semantic.description: A colorless, polar aprotic solvent with a high boiling point, widely used in chemical synthesis and peptide coupling.

assets.notes: Combustible and toxic organic solvent; known hepatotoxin and readily absorbed through skin. Store in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Dioxane

semantic.description: A colorless liquid cyclic ether with a faint sweet odor, commonly used as a solvent for various organic substances.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and toxic organic solvent (suspected carcinogen). Can form explosive peroxides over time; store away from light and air. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Ethanol

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile, flammable liquid alcohol, commonly used as a solvent, fuel, and disinfectant.

assets.notes: Highly flammable organic solvent; keep away from oxidizers and heat sources. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: EthylAcetate

semantic.description: A colorless liquid organic compound with a characteristic sweet smell, commonly used as a solvent in glues, nail polish removers, and chemical extractions.

assets.notes: Flammable and volatile organic solvent; vapors may cause drowsiness. Must be stored in reagent cabinet away from ignition sources.

assets.name: EthylFormate

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile liquid ester with a characteristic rum-like odor, commonly used as a solvent and in flavorings.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and volatile organic ester; requires storage away from ignition sources. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Heptane

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable liquid alkane hydrocarbon used primarily as a non-polar solvent and a standard for octane ratings.

assets.notes: Flammable and volatile organic solvent; poses inhalation toxicity risks. Must be stored in reagent cabinet away from ignition sources.

assets.name: Hexane

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile liquid alkane, widely used as a non-polar organic solvent in laboratories and industry.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and volatile organic solvent with potential neurotoxicity; must be stored in a reagent cabinet away from ignition sources.

assets.name: Methanol

semantic.description: A colorless, volatile, flammable, and toxic liquid alcohol, widely used as an industrial solvent and fuel.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and toxic organic solvent; poses severe health risks if ingested or inhaled. Must be stored in reagent cabinet away from ignition sources.

assets.name: Pentane

semantic.description: A clear, colorless, highly flammable liquid alkane commonly used as a non-polar solvent in laboratory applications.

assets.notes: Extremely flammable and volatile organic solvent; vapors may form explosive mixtures with air. Must be stored in a cool, well-ventilated reagent cabinet away from heat sources.

assets.name: NPropanol

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable liquid alcohol acting as an isomer of isopropanol, commonly used as a solvent in pharmaceutical and chemical manufacturing.

assets.notes: Flammable and volatile organic solvent. Must be kept away from heat, sparks, and open flames. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Pyridine

semantic.description: A basic heterocyclic organic compound with a distinct, unpleasant fish-like odor, widely used as a solvent and reagent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Pyridine is a flammable, toxic, and basic organic solvent. It has a strong, unpleasant odor and should be handled in a fume hood when in use, but stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Tetrahydrofuran

semantic.description: A colorless, water-miscible organic liquid with low viscosity, widely used as a polar aprotic solvent and precursor to polymers.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and volatile organic solvent. Can form explosive peroxides upon prolonged exposure to air; requires careful handling. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Toluene

semantic.description: A colorless, water-insoluble liquid with a distinct smell, widely used as an industrial feedstock and organic solvent.

assets.notes: Flammable and volatile organic solvent with toxicity concerns. Must be stored in a reagent cabinet away from heat and oxidizers.

assets.name: Water

semantic.description: A transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid acting as a universal solvent, essential for preparing solutions and cleaning in the laboratory.

assets.notes: Universal solvent; generally safe and non-hazardous. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Ammonia

semantic.description: A colorless inorganic compound with a distinct pungent smell, commonly used in laboratories as a weak base in aqueous solution.

assets.notes: Volatile weak base with pungent toxic fumes; typically stored as aqueous solution in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: BariumHydroxideOctahydrate

semantic.description: A white crystalline inorganic compound acting as a strong base, commonly used in analytical chemistry for the titration of weak acids.

assets.notes: Strong base and toxic barium compound; causes severe skin burns and eye damage. Store in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: FormicAcid

semantic.description: The simplest carboxylic acid, appearing as a colorless liquid with a pungent odor, commonly used as a preservative and antibacterial agent.

assets.notes: Corrosive organic acid with toxic/irritating vapors; combustible liquid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: HydrobromicAcid

semantic.description: A strong mineral acid formed by dissolving hydrogen bromide in water, commonly used for the production of inorganic bromides and organobromine compounds.

assets.notes: Strong corrosive acid that releases toxic fumes; causes severe burns. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: HydrochloricAcid

semantic.description: A colorless, highly pungent solution of hydrogen chloride in water, classified as a strong corrosive acid widely used in laboratory and industrial applications.

assets.notes: Strong corrosive acid that releases toxic hydrogen chloride fumes; requires handling in a fume hood but stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: LithiumHydroxide

semantic.description: A strong inorganic base commonly used as a carbon dioxide scrubber and in the production of lithium greases and batteries.

assets.notes: Strong inorganic base; corrosive and toxic. Absorbs carbon dioxide from the air. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MagnesiumHydroxide

semantic.description: A white inorganic solid that is slightly soluble in water, commonly used as an antacid, laxative, and flame retardant.

assets.notes: Weak inorganic base; commonly used as a flame retardant and antacid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: NitricAcid

semantic.description: A highly corrosive mineral acid and strong oxidizing agent, commonly used in the production of fertilizers and explosives.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizing acid and corrosive; releases toxic fumes. Must be stored in reagent cabinet away from organic materials and bases.

assets.name: Piperidine

semantic.description: A colorless organic liquid with a characteristic odor, acting as a secondary amine and widely used as a base and reagent in chemical synthesis.

assets.notes: Flammable and toxic organic base; requires proper ventilation and storage away from acids and oxidizers. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: PotassiumCarbonate

semantic.description: A white, odorless salt that is soluble in water, commonly used in the production of glass and soap, and as a mild drying agent.

assets.notes: A basic inorganic salt used as a mild drying agent. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: PotassiumHydroxide

semantic.description: A strong inorganic base, commonly known as caustic potash, appearing as a white deliquescent solid. It is highly corrosive and widely used in chemical synthesis, electrolyte solutions, and pH regulation.

assets.notes: Strong inorganic base (caustic potash); highly corrosive and deliquescent. Reacts exothermically with water and acids. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumCarbonate

semantic.description: A white, odorless, water-soluble salt commonly used as a cleaning agent, pH regulator, and in glass manufacturing.

assets.notes: A basic inorganic salt used as a pH regulator. It is an irritant but generally stable. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumEthoxide

semantic.description: A strong organic base appearing as a white to yellowish powder, commonly used in organic synthesis for condensation and deprotonation reactions.

assets.notes: Strong organic base and flammable solid; reacts with moisture. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumHydroxide

semantic.description: A strong base and alkali, typically appearing as white solid pellets or a solution, widely used for neutralization and pH regulation in chemical processes.

assets.notes: Strong base and corrosive; causes severe burns. Reacts exothermically with acids and moisture. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SulfuricAcid

semantic.description: A highly corrosive, colorless, oily, strong mineral acid used extensively in chemical synthesis and industrial applications.

assets.notes: Highly corrosive strong mineral acid; reacts violently with water, bases, and organic materials. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: TrifluoroaceticAcid

semantic.description: A strong, colorless organofluorine carboxylic acid commonly used in organic synthesis, peptide synthesis, and as an ion pairing agent in HPLC.

assets.notes: Strong, corrosive, and volatile organic acid. Causes severe skin burns and eye damage. Toxic if inhaled. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Triethylamine

semantic.description: A colorless volatile liquid with a strong fishy odor, commonly used in organic synthesis as a base and acid scavenger.

assets.notes: Flammable, volatile, and toxic organic base. Must be stored in a reagent cabinet and handled with care, typically in a fume hood due to strong odor and toxicity.

assets.name: Carbonyldiimidazole

semantic.description: A white crystalline solid commonly used in organic synthesis for the activation of carboxylic acids and peptide coupling.

assets.notes: Moisture-sensitive coupling reagent; toxic and corrosive. Reacts with water to release carbon dioxide. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Dicyclohexylcarbodiimide

semantic.description: A waxy white solid organic compound primarily used as a coupling agent in peptide synthesis and as a dehydrating agent in organic chemistry.

assets.notes: Potent allergen and toxic substance; causes severe skin sensitization. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: DimethylformamideDimethylAcetal

synonyms: N,N-二甲基甲酰胺二甲基缩醛
semantic.description: A versatile organic reagent commonly used as a methylating agent for carboxylic acids and phenols, and for the formation of formamidine derivatives.

assets.notes: Flammable liquid and moisture sensitive; commonly used as a methylating agent. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: OxalylChloride

semantic.description: A colorless, fuming liquid used as a powerful chlorinating agent in organic synthesis, particularly for converting carboxylic acids to acid chlorides and in Swern oxidation.

assets.notes: Corrosive and toxic fuming liquid; reacts violently with water to release HCl and gases. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Phosgene

semantic.description: A colorless, highly toxic gas or volatile liquid with an odor resembling freshly cut hay, widely used as a building block in organic synthesis and the production of plastics.

assets.notes: Extremely toxic and volatile substance; fatal if inhaled. Reacts with water to form corrosive byproducts. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: PhosphorusOxychloride

semantic.description: A colorless to slightly yellow fuming liquid used primarily as a chlorinating agent and in the manufacture of phosphate esters.

assets.notes: Reacts violently with water to release heat and toxic/corrosive fumes (HCl). Highly toxic and corrosive fuming liquid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Phenyltetrachlorophosphorane

semantic.description: A hypervalent organophosphorus compound used primarily as a chlorinating agent in organic synthesis to convert carboxylic acids to acyl chlorides.

assets.notes: Corrosive chlorinating agent; reacts violently with water to release toxic HCl gas. Moisture sensitive. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SulfurylChloride

semantic.description: A colorless liquid with a pungent odor, commonly used as a chlorinating and sulfonating agent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Sulfuryl chloride is a corrosive, toxic liquid that reacts violently with water to release acidic gases (HCl and SO2). It acts as a chlorinating and oxidizing agent. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: ThionylChloride

semantic.description: A colorless to yellow liquid inorganic compound used primarily as a chlorinating agent in organic synthesis to convert carboxylic acids and alcohols to acyl chlorides and alkyl chlorides.

assets.notes: Corrosive and toxic liquid that reacts violently with water to release harmful gases (HCl and SO2). Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: ChloroperbenzoicAcid

semantic.description: A solid organic peroxy acid widely used as an oxidizing agent in organic synthesis, particularly for the epoxidation of alkenes.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizing agent and organic peroxide; shock-sensitive and potentially explosive. Must be stored in a reagent cabinet, kept cool, and away from reducing agents.

assets.name: Bromine

semantic.description: A fuming red-brown liquid halogen that is corrosive and toxic, commonly used in chemical synthesis and flame retardants.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizing agent, highly toxic, and fuming liquid. Causes severe burns. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: ChromiumTrioxide

semantic.description: A dark red, hygroscopic solid acting as a powerful oxidizing agent and acidic anhydride, widely used in organic synthesis and chrome plating.

assets.notes: Powerful oxidizing agent and acidic anhydride; highly toxic (carcinogenic) and corrosive. Can cause ignition or explosion when in contact with organic materials. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: DibutyltinOxide

semantic.description: A white solid organotin compound commonly used as a catalyst in esterification and transesterification reactions.

assets.notes: Toxic organotin compound used as a catalyst; causes skin and eye irritation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: DipyridineChromiumOxide

semantic.description: A complex of chromium(VI) oxide and pyridine, commonly used as a mild oxidizing agent to convert primary alcohols to aldehydes without further oxidation.

assets.notes: Chromium(VI) compound; highly toxic and carcinogenic. Strong oxidizer; contact with combustible material may cause fire. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: HydrogenPeroxide

semantic.description: A colorless liquid acting as a strong oxidizing agent, commonly used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, and bleaching agent.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizing agent; accelerates combustion of other materials. Corrosive and irritant. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Iodine

semantic.description: A lustrous, purple-black non-metallic solid halogen that sublimes easily, commonly used as a disinfectant and in chemical synthesis.

assets.notes: Iodine is an oxidizing solid that sublimes easily into toxic vapors; it should be stored in a tightly sealed container away from reducing agents.

assets.name: SilverOxide

semantic.description: A fine black or dark brown powder used as an oxidizing agent in chemical synthesis and in batteries.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizing agent and mild base; sensitive to light. Can form explosive compounds if mixed with ammonia or combustible materials. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumBorohydride

semantic.description: A white crystalline solid commonly used as a selective reducing agent in organic synthesis, particularly for reducing aldehydes and ketones to alcohols.

assets.notes: Water-reactive reducing agent that releases flammable hydrogen gas; toxic and basic. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumHydride

semantic.description: A strong base and reducing agent used in organic synthesis, typically appearing as a grey or white solid often dispersed in mineral oil to prevent reaction with moisture.

assets.notes: Strong base and reducing agent; reacts violently with water to release flammable hydrogen gas. Typically stored in mineral oil to prevent reaction with moisture.

assets.name: SodiumMetabisulfite

semantic.description: A white crystalline powder commonly used as a disinfectant, antioxidant, and preservative agent.

assets.notes: A reducing agent and antioxidant; releases toxic sulfur dioxide gas upon contact with acids. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumSulfite

semantic.description: A white, water-soluble solid used primarily as a reducing agent, preservative, and in the pulp and paper industry.

assets.notes: A reducing agent that reacts with acids to release toxic sulfur dioxide gas. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: ArsenicTrioxide

semantic.description: A white, inorganic compound and the principal oxide of arsenic, known for its high toxicity and use as a precursor to elemental arsenic and other arsenic compounds.

assets.notes: Extremely toxic inorganic compound (Class 6.1); fatal if swallowed or inhaled. Must be handled with extreme care and stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: BariumNitrate

semantic.description: A white crystalline solid inorganic compound used as an oxidizer and commonly applied in pyrotechnics to produce green flames.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizer and toxic barium compound; commonly used in pyrotechnics. Must be stored away from flammable materials and reducing agents in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: CopperNitrateTrihydrate

semantic.description: A blue crystalline inorganic compound commonly used in organic synthesis, textiles, and as an oxidizing agent.

assets.notes: Strong oxidizing agent and toxic substance; must be kept away from combustible materials. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: CopperSulfate

semantic.description: An inorganic compound that typically appears as blue crystals in its pentahydrate form or white powder when anhydrous, commonly used as a fungicide, herbicide, and analytical reagent.

assets.notes: Inorganic salt commonly used as a reagent and fungicide. Harmful if swallowed and causes serious eye damage; toxic to aquatic life. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: LeadHydroxide

semantic.description: A white amorphous powder or crystalline solid, slightly soluble in water, often used in the manufacture of porous glass and as a catalyst.

assets.notes: Toxic lead compound and weak base; handle with care to avoid ingestion or inhalation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Litharge

semantic.description: A natural mineral form of lead(II) oxide, typically appearing as a yellow or reddish-yellow solid used in the manufacture of glass, ceramics, and varnishes.

assets.notes: Litharge (Lead(II) oxide) is a toxic lead compound. It should be handled with care to avoid inhalation or ingestion. All reagents are stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MagnesiumOxide

semantic.description: A white, hygroscopic solid mineral that occurs naturally as periclase, commonly used as a refractory material, antacid, or laboratory reagent.

assets.notes: A basic inorganic oxide and hygroscopic solid. It is generally safe but should be kept dry. All reagents are stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MercuricChloride

semantic.description: A highly toxic, white crystalline solid compound of mercury and chlorine, commonly used as a catalyst in organic synthesis and historically as a disinfectant.

assets.notes: Extremely toxic mercury compound; fatal if swallowed or in contact with skin. Requires strict safety protocols. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: PotassiumCyanate

semantic.description: A colorless crystalline inorganic compound used chiefly as a basic raw material for organic synthesis and as a herbicide.

assets.notes: Harmful if swallowed or inhaled. While less toxic than cyanides, it requires careful handling. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Sodium

semantic.description: A soft, silvery-white, highly reactive alkali metal, typically stored under oil or kerosene to prevent oxidation and reaction with moisture.

assets.notes: Highly reactive alkali metal; reacts violently with water and moisture. Typically stored under oil. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumChloride

semantic.description: A white crystalline solid commonly known as table salt, widely used as a chemical reagent and in the preparation of saline solutions.

assets.notes: Stable inorganic salt; generally safe for handling. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumCyanide

semantic.description: A highly toxic, white, water-soluble inorganic solid widely used in gold mining, electroplating, and organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Extremely toxic; fatal if swallowed, inhaled, or absorbed through skin. Contact with acids liberates highly toxic hydrogen cyanide gas. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumThiophenolate

semantic.description: A chemical reagent consisting of the sodium salt of thiophenol, commonly used as a strong nucleophile in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: A strong nucleophile and base; hydrolyzes in moist air to release toxic and foul-smelling thiophenol. Corrosive.

assets.name: TetraNButylammoniumIodide

semantic.description: A quaternary ammonium salt commonly used as a phase transfer catalyst and a source of iodide ions in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Quaternary ammonium salt used as a phase transfer catalyst. Generally acts as an irritant; sensitive to light. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: AceticAnhydride

semantic.description: A colorless liquid with a pungent vinegar-like odor, widely used as an acetylating agent in organic synthesis and for preparing aspirin and cellulose acetate.

assets.notes: Flammable and corrosive liquid; acts as a lachrymator (causes eye irritation). Reacts with water to form acetic acid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Acetamide

semantic.description: A white crystalline organic compound derived from acetic acid, commonly used as a solvent, plasticizer, and in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Acetamide is a suspected carcinogen and should be handled with care to avoid inhalation or skin contact. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Acetaldehyde

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable liquid or gas with a pungent, fruity odor, widely used as a precursor in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Extremely flammable and volatile liquid/gas; toxic and a suspected carcinogen. Must be stored in a reagent cabinet, preferably in a cool environment.

assets.name: Benzaldehyde

semantic.description: A colorless liquid with a characteristic almond-like odor, serving as the simplest aromatic aldehyde and widely used in organic synthesis and as a precursor.

assets.notes: Combustible liquid (flash point ~63°C) and harmful if swallowed or inhaled. It is sensitive to air and light, oxidizing to benzoic acid over time. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Benzylamine

semantic.description: A colorless liquid with a strong ammonia-like odor, consisting of a benzyl group attached to an amine functional group, commonly used in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Benzylamine is a corrosive, combustible organic base with toxic properties. It should be stored in a reagent cabinet, separated from acids and oxidizing agents.

assets.name: BenzoylIsothiocyanate

semantic.description: An organic chemical compound containing a benzoyl group attached to an isothiocyanate group, commonly used as an intermediate in organic synthesis for preparing thiourea derivatives.

assets.notes: Lachrymator (tear-inducing) and corrosive organic reagent. Moisture sensitive. Store in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Bis4FluorophenylMethyleneChloride

semantic.description: A halogenated organic reagent featuring two 4-fluorophenyl groups attached to a central chloromethyl group, commonly used as an electrophilic building block in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Halogenated organic reagent acting as an electrophile. Likely corrosive and lachrymatory; reacts with moisture to release HCl. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: ChloroaceticAcid

semantic.description: A colorless or white crystalline solid organochlorine compound that is highly corrosive and widely used as a building block in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Highly corrosive and toxic organic acid; causes severe burns and systemic toxicity. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Crotonaldehyde

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable, and corrosive liquid with a pungent odor, used primarily as a precursor in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Flammable, corrosive, and toxic liquid with a pungent odor. All reagents are stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Diazomethane

semantic.description: A yellow, toxic, and explosive gas commonly used in organic synthesis as a powerful methylating agent.

assets.notes: Extremely toxic and explosive gas; typically handled in solution. Requires specialized smooth glassware to prevent detonation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: EthylAcetoacetate

semantic.description: A colorless liquid organic compound with a fruity odor, widely used as a chemical intermediate in organic synthesis and as a flavoring agent.

assets.notes: Combustible organic liquid used as an intermediate in organic synthesis. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: EthylCrotonate

semantic.description: An unsaturated organic ester appearing as a colorless liquid, commonly used as a chemical intermediate in organic synthesis and as a solvent.

assets.notes: Flammable liquid ester; causes skin and eye irritation. Must be stored away from ignition sources and oxidizers in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: EthylEthoxymethylenemalonate

synonyms: 乙氧基亚甲基丙二酸二乙酯
semantic.description: A versatile organic building block used in the synthesis of heterocycles, particularly quinoline derivatives and pharmaceuticals.

assets.notes: Versatile organic building block (liquid ester); harmful if swallowed and causes irritation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Formaldehyde

semantic.description: A colorless, strong-smelling gas often used in aqueous solution as a disinfectant, preservative, and fixative for biological tissues.

assets.notes: Toxic, carcinogenic, and flammable; requires proper ventilation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Hydrazine

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable liquid with an ammonia-like odor, commonly used as a strong reducing agent, oxygen scavenger, and in rocket fuels.

assets.notes: Highly toxic, flammable, and unstable liquid that can decompose explosively; acts as a base and strong reducing agent. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: IsoamylNitrite

semantic.description: A chemical compound used as a vasodilator, an antidote for cyanide poisoning, and a nitrosating agent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and toxic liquid; sensitive to light and heat. Acts as a nitrosating agent.

assets.name: Iodopropane

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable liquid alkyl iodide commonly used as an alkylating agent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Flammable and toxic alkylating agent; sensitive to light. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: IsopropylAlcohol

semantic.description: A colorless, flammable chemical compound with a strong odor, widely used as a solvent, disinfectant, and cleaning agent.

assets.notes: Flammable and volatile organic solvent; keep away from heat sources and oxidizers. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: IsopropylIsocyanate

semantic.description: A colorless liquid organic compound used as an intermediate in the synthesis of pharmaceuticals and pesticides.

assets.notes: Highly flammable and toxic liquid; acts as a lacrimator and respiratory sensitizer. Reacts with moisture. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: LAsparticAcid

semantic.description: A non-essential alpha-amino acid with an acidic side chain, widely used in the biosynthesis of proteins and as a precursor for other amino acids.

assets.notes: A non-essential amino acid with an acidic side chain; generally considered low hazard but acts as a weak acid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MetaChloroaniline

semantic.description: A toxic, light amber liquid organic compound used primarily as an intermediate in the production of dyes, pesticides, and pharmaceuticals.

assets.notes: Toxic organic liquid and weak base; requires careful handling to avoid skin contact and inhalation. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MethylThiosalicylate

semantic.description: An organic ester derivative of thiosalicylic acid, commonly used as a reagent in organic synthesis and pharmaceutical chemistry.

assets.notes: Organic reagent containing a thiol group; typically has a strong, unpleasant odor and acts as an irritant. Should be handled with care, preferably in a fume hood. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MethylTosylate

semantic.description: A highly reactive and toxic organic compound commonly used as a strong methylating agent in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: A potent and highly toxic methylating agent (alkylating agent) with potential carcinogenic properties. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: MethylTrichloroacetimidate

semantic.description: A chemical reagent commonly used to convert alcohols into trichloroacetimidates, serving as versatile intermediates for glycosylation reactions and the protection of hydroxyl groups.

assets.notes: Organic reagent used for glycosylation; acts as an irritant and should be handled with care. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Nicotine

semantic.description: A potent parasympathomimetic alkaloid found in the nightshade family of plants, acting as a stimulant and toxic substance.

assets.notes: Highly toxic alkaloid acting as a weak base. Combustible liquid. Requires strict safety precautions due to high toxicity. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: PhenylIsocyanate

semantic.description: A colorless to slightly yellow liquid organic compound used as a reagent for identifying alcohols and amines, and as an intermediate in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Toxic, lachrymator, and flammable liquid. Reacts with water and moisture. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: PhenylphosphonicAcid

semantic.description: A white crystalline organophosphorus compound used as a reagent in organic synthesis and as an intermediate for flame retardants.

assets.notes: Corrosive organic acid; causes severe skin burns and eye damage. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: SodiumPToluenesulfinate

semantic.description: A stable white crystalline powder used as a reagent in organic synthesis, commonly employed for introducing sulfonyl groups or in radical reactions.

assets.notes: Stable organic salt used as a reagent; stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: TertButylAlcohol

semantic.description: A colorless solid or liquid tertiary alcohol with a camphor-like odor, widely used as a solvent and in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Flammable solid or liquid (melting point ~25°C); vapors may form explosive mixtures with air. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: TertButylCarbazate

semantic.description: A chemical reagent used in organic synthesis, particularly as a source of the tert-butoxycarbonyl (Boc) protecting group for hydrazines and in peptide synthesis.

assets.notes: Flammable solid and toxic; commonly used as a Boc-protecting group agent. Store in reagent cabinet away from heat and oxidizers.

assets.name: Thiobenzamide

semantic.description: A yellow crystalline organosulfur compound used as a building block in organic synthesis, particularly for the preparation of heterocyclic compounds.

assets.notes: Organosulfur compound; harmful if swallowed and causes irritation. Releases toxic fumes (sulfur oxides, nitrogen oxides) upon thermal decomposition. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Thiophenol

semantic.description: An organosulfur compound with a distinctively foul odor, acting as the sulfur analogue of phenol and used widely in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Thiophenol is a toxic, flammable liquid with an extremely potent and unpleasant odor. It is weakly acidic (more so than phenol). Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Triethoxymethane

semantic.description: A colorless liquid orthoester commonly used in organic synthesis as a dehydrating agent and for the protection of carbonyl groups.

assets.notes: Flammable liquid orthoester; sensitive to moisture. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: TrimethylsilylAzide

semantic.description: A colorless liquid organosilicon compound used as a reagent in organic synthesis, often employed as a safer alternative to hydrazoic acid for introducing azide groups.

assets.notes: Flammable and toxic organosilicon reagent. Reacts with moisture to form toxic and potentially explosive hydrazoic acid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Triphenylphosphine

semantic.description: A common organophosphorus compound widely used in organic synthesis, such as the Wittig reaction, and as a ligand for transition metal catalysts.

assets.notes: Organophosphorus compound used as a ligand and reducing agent. Harmful if swallowed and potential skin sensitizer. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Dibromohexane

semantic.description: A halogenated organic compound consisting of a hexane chain with two bromine atoms, commonly used as an alkylating agent or intermediate in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Combustible liquid and alkylating agent; acts as an irritant. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: 1Bromo2Fluoroethane

semantic.description: A haloalkane reagent used in organic synthesis, typically serving as an alkylating agent to introduce the 2-fluoroethyl group.

assets.notes: Flammable and toxic alkylating agent; volatile liquid. Stored in reagent cabinet.

assets.name: ChlorophenylIsocyanide

semantic.description: An organic compound featuring an isocyanide group attached to a chlorophenyl ring, typically used as a ligand in coordination chemistry or a reactant in multicomponent synthesis.

assets.notes: Isocyanides are known for their extremely unpleasant odor and toxicity; they are also flammable. Must be handled with care, preferably in a fume hood, but stored in the reagent cabinet.

assets.name: Chlorophenylisocyanate

semantic.description: An organic compound containing a chlorophenyl group attached to an isocyanate functional group, commonly used as an intermediate in organic synthesis.

assets.notes: Toxic lachrymator and sensitizer; reacts with water and moisture. Stored in reagent cabinet.
